thread.section_title: Arsene Wenger reveals West Brom fears as under-fire Arsenal prepare for Hawthorns test – Metro
thread.title: Arsene Wenger reveals West Brom fears as under-fire Arsenal prepare for Hawthorns test
thread.title_full: Arsene Wenger reveals West Brom fears as under-fire Arsenal prepare for Hawthorns test

author: louissealey1
title: Arsene Wenger reveals West Brom fears as under-fire Arsenal prepare for Hawthorns test
text:
Arsene Wenger Arsenal’s take on West Brom on Saturday (Picture: Getty) Arsene Wenger admits ‘well-organised’ and ‘physical’ West Brom will provide a stern test for his Arsenal side at the Hawthorns this weekend.
After the FA Cup thrashing over non-league outfit Lincoln City, the Gunners turn their attentions to the Premier League with the hope of making up ground on the top four.
Mbappe & the four Monaco stars Chelsea, Man Utd and Arsenal should be fighting to sign Arsenal’s slump since the New Year has seen the north London outfit slip to fifth – five points off fourth-placed Liverpool.
Wenger will be desperate to return to winning ways in the league on Saturday but the Frenchman is under no illusions over the potential of the Baggies.
Tony Pulis’ charge have climbed to eighth in the top-flight after an impressive run and Wenger is well aware of the threat forwards Salomon Rondon and Hal Robson-Kane pose.
‘West Brom have big experience and are well-organised,’ Wenger said. ‘Physically they are strong and efficient.
Arsenal fixtures West Brom (A) – Sat 18 Mar
Manchester City (H) – Sun 2 Apr
West Ham (H) – Wed 5 Apr
Crystal Palace (A) – Mon 10 Apr
Middlesbrough (A) – Mon 17 apr
Sunderland (H) – Sat 22 Apr
Tottenham (A) – Sun 30 Apr
Salomon Rondon has proved a threat for the Baggies this season (Picture: Getty) Tony Pulis has taken West Brom into the top-half of the Premier League (Picture: Getty) More: Football Antonio Conte unhappy with Chelsea's board and has ordered them to make a major change 
Arsene Wenger speaks out on Barcelona's interest in Hector Bellerin 
Monaco respond to Mbappe transfer links to Arsenal and Man United 
‘They’ve scored more goals from set-pieces than anyone else. In midfield they are strong and up front, Rondon and Robson-Kane have done very well.
‘The balance in the team is good with size so they are equipped to deal with the Premier League.’
MORE: Wenger dismisses Barcelona’s interest in Hector Bellerin
